title: Filipa Patão shared her thoughts on becoming the inaugural head coach of Boston Legacy FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Filipa Patão joins Boston Legacy FC as the first head coach, leaving her role at Portugal's Benfica after winning five titles.
Patão will lead the team into the 2026 NWSL season, collaborating with ex-Barcelona executive Domènec Guasch on team assembly.
Don't miss Patão's impressions of Boston sports culture and her first taste of local cuisine, including the iconic lobster roll.

title: Jeremy Swayman feels like a ‘completely different human being’ a year removed from contract dispute
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman signed an eight-year, $66 million contract with the Boston Bruins after a year of contract disputes.
Swayman, who struggled last season, feels ready for a fresh start at the Bruins' upcoming training camp.
Follow Swayman's journey as he aims to strengthen his position as Boston's top goalie this season.

title: What Josh McDaniels said about facing the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Josh McDaniels will face his former team, the Raiders, as New England Patriots offensive coordinator in Sunday's home opener.
McDaniels expressed no ill will towards the Raiders and praised new coach Pete Carroll ahead of their matchup.
Consider how Drake Maye and Stefon Diggs will impact the Patriots' offense in their season opener at Gillette Stadium.

title: Elizabeth Banks cast as Karen Read: What readers said about the limited series role
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Elizabeth Banks, a Pittsfield native, will star as Karen Read in Prime Video's series about the controversial murder case.
48% of readers support Banks' casting, while 38% disagree and 14% are indifferent or proposed other actresses.
Tune in for how this Pittsfield actress brings local grit to her portrayal of Read in Massachusetts' legal saga.

author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Mohegan Sun and Foxwoods Resort Casino in Connecticut ranked No. 2 and No. 3 among non-Vegas casinos in the U.S.

title: What to know about Seisiún, the two-day Irish music festival coming to Boston
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Seisiún features The Pogues' first U.S. performance in over 20 years, headlining Day 2 at Suffolk Downs in Boston.
Single-day tickets for Seisiún range from $75 for GA lawn to $257 for Turf Club VIP seating.
Bring blankets and beach chairs for the lawn, but remember that tailgating is prohibited at Seisiún.

title: CommonWealth Kitchen staff, members speak out over toxic nonprofit: Globe report
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: CommonWealth Kitchen staff accuses leadership of creating a toxic workplace, citing lack of support and insensitive comments by director Jen Faigel.
Gourmet Kreyol's Nathalie Lecorps claims CWK overcharged rent and used her story for fundraising, sending a cease-and-desist letter.
Check out the steps CWK is taking to address staff complaints and reshape its organizational culture.

title: Juvenile with ‘airsoft replica weapon’ determined to have caused UMass Lowell lockdown
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A juvenile's airsoft gun prompted a three-hour lockdown at UMass Lowell, involving a large law enforcement presence.
